vocabinfos.mediumDef:
§ Jephthah or Jiphtah = "he opens"
n pr m
This name is used for:
1) a son of Gilead and a concubine and the judge who defeated the Ammonites; after the victory because of a vow taken before the battle he sacrificed his daughter as a burnt offering
n pr loc
2) a city in Judah
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a)   ciudad; territorio de Judá; (b)   juez de Israel
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
耶弗他 或 益弗他 这个字在希伯來文的意思是 "他開路"
陽性專有名詞
1) 基列和其妾所生的兒子, 他是帶領以色列人打敗亞捫人的士師;
為著在戰鬥前所立的誓, 於勝利後將其女兒獻作燔祭的犧牲.
(士 11)
專有名詞 地名
2) 猶大屬地的一個城市 (書 15:43)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
耶弗他 或 益弗他 这个字在希伯来文的意思是 "他开路"
阳性专有名词
1) 基列和其妾所生的儿子, 他是带领以色列人打败亚扪人的士师;
为着在战斗前所立的誓, 于胜利后将其女儿献作燔祭的牺牲.
(士 11)
专有名词 地名
2) 犹大属地的一个城市 (书 15:43)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Israel before the Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.11.1;
son of: Gilead (H1568I)
Also named: Iephthae<\i> (Ἰεφθάε "Jephthah" G2422)
§ Jephthah or Jiphtah = "he opens"
n pr m
1) a son of Gilead and a concubine and the judge who defeated the Ammonites; after the victory because of a vow taken before the battle he sacrificed his daughter as a burnt offering
n pr loc
2) a city in Judah
